metadata.title: CVE-2018-12386 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in register allocation in JavaScript can lead to typeconfusion, allowing for an arbitrary read and write. This leads to remotecode execution inside the sandboxed content process when triggered. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.2.2 and Firefox < 62.0.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12386` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
